Nutrition

A well-balanced diet impacts brain function, energy levels, and emotional stability. Certain foods directly influence neurotransmitters like serotonin and dopamine, which affect mood and motivation.

Essential Nutrients and Their Benefits:

  • Proteins: Crucial for brain neurotransmitters and muscle repair (sources: paneer, tofu, chickpeas, lentils, nuts).
  • Carbohydrates: Provide sustained energy and regulate blood sugar levels (sources: oats, whole grains, quinoa, bananas).
  • Healthy Fats: Support brain function and hormone regulation (sources: avocados, nuts, flaxseeds, olive oil).
  • Vitamins & Minerals: Strengthen immunity and boost mood (sources: leafy greens, citrus fruits, dairy products).

Affordable Vegetarian Meal Ideas for Students:

  • Overnight Oats: Soak oats with milk or yogurt, nuts, and fruits for a quick breakfast.
  • Kettle Meals: Prepare boiled potatoes, instant soups, or simple lentil dishes.
  • Quick Protein Snacks: Roasted chickpeas, peanut butter sandwiches, or soy milk.
  • Nutritious Breakfasts: Whole wheat toast with hummus, banana smoothies, or vegetable omelets.
